metadata.description: COMPLETE Master Error Detection Framework - ALL citation errors

errors.description: Quote of 50+ words must be formatted as block quote (indented, no quotation marks)
errors.fix_pattern: Convert to block quote format: remove quotation marks, indent entire passage

examples.incorrect: "This is a very long quotation that contains more than fifty words and should therefore be formatted as a block quotation according to Bluebook Rule 5.1, but it has been incorrectly formatted as an inline quotation with quotation marks, which violates the rule and should be corrected by removing the quotation marks and indenting the text."
examples.correct: This is a very long quotation that contains more than fifty words and should therefore be formatted as a block quotation according to Bluebook Rule 5.1, and it has been correctly formatted as a block quotation by removing the quotation marks and indenting the text.

errors.description: Quote under 50 words should not be block quoted
errors.fix_pattern: Convert to inline quote: add quotation marks, remove indentation

examples.incorrect: This short quote should be inline.

errors.description: Block quotation incorrectly includes outer quotation marks
errors.fix_pattern: Remove outer quotation marks from block quote

examples.incorrect: "This is a block quote that incorrectly has quotation marks around it."
examples.correct: This is a block quote that correctly has no quotation marks around it.

errors.description: Block quotation fails to preserve internal quotation marks from original
errors.fix_pattern: Preserve original internal quotation marks in block quote

examples.incorrect: The court stated that the defendant was negligent.
examples.correct: The court stated that "the defendant was negligent."

errors.description: Verify quotation length and format compliance
errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Count the exact number of words in this quotation. If it contains 50 or more words, it must be formatted as a block quotation (indented, without outer quotation marks). If it contains fewer than 50 words, it should be an inline quotation with quotation marks. Return: {"word_count": <number>, "is_compliant": <boolean>, "required_format": "block"|"inline"}

errors.description: Verify internal quotation marks are preserved in block quotes
errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Examine this block quotation. Does it properly preserve internal quotation marks that were present in the original source material? Look for quoted speech, quoted terms, or other internal quotes that should be maintained. Return: {"has_internal_quotes": <boolean>, "properly_preserved": <boolean>, "issues": []}

errors.rule_title: Quotations - Alterations and Quotations Within Quotations
errors.description: Alteration to quoted text not indicated with brackets
errors.fix_pattern: Enclose all alterations in brackets

examples.incorrect: "The defendant he was negligent."

errors.rule_title: Quotations - Alterations and Quotations Within Quotations
errors.description: Error in original quotation not marked with [sic]
errors.fix_pattern: Add [sic] after preserved errors from original

examples.incorrect: "The defendent was negligent."

errors.rule_title: Quotations - Alterations and Quotations Within Quotations
errors.description: [sic] formatted incorrectly (should be in brackets, lowercase, not italicized in brackets)
errors.fix_pattern: Format as [sic] - lowercase, in brackets

examples.incorrect: "The defendent sic was negligent." or "[SIC]" or "[Sic]"

errors.rule_title: Quotations - Alterations and Quotations Within Quotations
errors.description: Changed capitalization not indicated with brackets
errors.fix_pattern: Bracket altered capital letters

examples.incorrect: "the Court held..." (when original was "The Court held...")

errors.rule_title: Quotations - Alterations and Quotations Within Quotations
errors.description: Nested quotation marks not properly alternated between double and single
errors.fix_pattern: Alternate between double and single quotation marks for nested quotes

examples.incorrect: "The witness said "I saw it" clearly."

errors.rule_title: Quotations - Alterations and Quotations Within Quotations
errors.description: Triple-nested quotations not properly alternated (should go: double > single > double)
errors.fix_pattern: Use double quotes for outermost, single for second level, double for third level

examples.incorrect: "The article stated 'The witness said 'I saw it' clearly' in testimony."
examples.correct: "The article stated 'The witness said "I saw it" clearly' in testimony."

errors.rule_title: Quotations - Alterations and Quotations Within Quotations
errors.description: Verify all alterations are properly bracketed
errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Examine this quotation and compare it to the implied original context. Are there any alterations to the original text (added words, changed words, changed capitalization) that are not properly indicated with brackets? Return: {"has_alterations": <boolean>, "all_properly_bracketed": <boolean>, "issues": [{"location": "", "alteration": "", "should_be": ""}]}

errors.rule_title: Quotations - Alterations and Quotations Within Quotations
errors.description: Verify [sic] is used correctly for preserved errors
errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Check if this quotation contains any errors from the original source. If errors are preserved, they should be followed by [sic]. If errors were corrected, they should be bracketed. Return: {"has_preserved_errors": <boolean>, "sic_properly_used": <boolean>, "issues": []}

errors.rule_title: Quotations - Alterations and Quotations Within Quotations
errors.description: Verify nested quotation marks are properly alternated
errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Analyze this quotation for nested quotes. Nested quotations should alternate between double and single quotation marks (outermost determines which). Check if the alternation is correct. Return: {"has_nested_quotes": <boolean>, "nesting_level": <number>, "properly_alternated": <boolean>, "should_be": ""}

errors.description: Omitted material within quotation not indicated with ellipsis
errors.fix_pattern: Add ellipsis (...) to indicate omitted material

examples.incorrect: "The defendant was negligent and caused harm." (when middle phrase omitted)
examples.correct: "The defendant was negligent ... and caused harm."

errors.description: Quote incorrectly begins with ellipsis when starting mid-sentence
errors.fix_pattern: Remove initial ellipsis; use lowercase or bracketed capital letter

examples.incorrect: "... the court held that negligence was proven."
examples.correct: "[T]he court held that negligence was proven." or "the court held that negligence was proven."

errors.description: Ellipsis not properly formatted (should be three periods with spaces)
errors.fix_pattern: Use exactly three periods for ellipsis: ...

examples.incorrect: "The court .. held" or "The court .... held"

errors.description: Ellipsis spacing incorrect (should have spaces before and after, or formatted as . . .)
errors.fix_pattern: Add spaces before and after ellipsis

examples.incorrect: "The court...held" or "text...more text"

errors.description: Ellipsis at end of sentence should be four dots (period + ellipsis) if sentence ends
errors.fix_pattern: Use four dots (. ...) when omission occurs at end of sentence

examples.incorrect: "The defendant was negligent ..."
examples.correct: "The defendant was negligent ...." (four dots when sentence ends)

errors.description: Omission fundamentally alters the meaning of the quotation
errors.fix_pattern: Do not omit material that changes fundamental meaning

examples.incorrect: "The court held ... the defendant liable." (when original said "not liable")
examples.correct: Use complete relevant portion or paraphrase instead

errors.description: Verify all omissions are marked with ellipsis
errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Compare this quotation to the original source text. Are there any omissions that are not properly marked with an ellipsis? Return: {"has_omissions": <boolean>, "all_properly_marked": <boolean>, "issues": [{"location": "", "omitted_text": ""}]}

Check all ellipses in this text for proper formatting. Initial ellipses (at quote start) should be removed if quote starts mid-sentence. Internal ellipses should be three dots with spacing. Terminal ellipses should be four dots if sentence ends. Return: {"ellipses_found": <number>, "all_properly_formatted": <boolean>, "issues": []}

Compare the quotation with omissions to the original source. Does the omission alter or misrepresent the fundamental meaning of the original text? Return: {"meaning_preserved": <boolean>, "misrepresentation_risk": "none"|"minor"|"major", "explanation": ""}

errors.description: Word abbreviated in textual sentence when it should be spelled out
errors.fix_pattern: Spell out words in textual sentences; abbreviate only in citations

examples.incorrect: The Corp. was negligent in its operations.
examples.correct: The Corporation was negligent in its operations.

errors.description: Word not abbreviated in citation when standard abbreviation exists
errors.fix_pattern: Use standard Bluebook abbreviations in citations per Tables T6, T7, T8, T10

examples.incorrect: Smith v. Jones Corporation, 123 F.3d 456 (9th Cir. 2000).
examples.correct: Smith v. Jones Corp., 123 F.3d 456 (9th Cir. 2000).

errors.description: Non-standard abbreviation used instead of Bluebook-approved form
errors.fix_pattern: Use exact Bluebook abbreviation forms from tables

examples.incorrect: Smith v. Jones Co, 123 F.3d 456 (9th Cir. 2000). (missing period)
examples.correct: Smith v. Jones Co., 123 F.3d 456 (9th Cir. 2000).

errors.description: Same term abbreviated inconsistently throughout document
errors.fix_pattern: Use consistent abbreviation form throughout document

examples.incorrect: Corporation in one citation, Corp. in another

errors.description: Geographical term not abbreviated per Table T10
errors.fix_pattern: Use Table T10 abbreviations for geographical terms

examples.incorrect: N.Y. Southern District Court (should be S.D.N.Y.)

errors.description: Widely known acronym unnecessarily spelled out in text
errors.fix_pattern: Use acronym form for widely known terms (FBI, CIA, OSHA, etc.)

examples.incorrect: The Federal Bureau of Investigation investigated...

errors.description: Distinguish text vs. citation and verify appropriate abbreviation usage
errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Analyze this text segment. Determine if it is textual prose or a citation. In textual sentences, most words should be spelled out (except widely known acronyms like FBI, CIA). In citations, standard Bluebook abbreviations must be used. Return: {"is_citation": <boolean>, "abbreviations_found": [{"term": "", "is_appropriate": <boolean>, "should_be": ""}]}

Check if this abbreviation matches the standard Bluebook abbreviation tables (T6 for case names, T7 for institutional authors, T8 for publishing terms, T10 for geographical terms). Return: {"abbreviation": "", "table": "", "is_standard": <boolean>, "correct_form": ""}

errors.description: Verify consistent abbreviation usage throughout document
errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Scan the document for uses of this term. Check if it is abbreviated consistently in all citations and spelled out consistently in all textual sentences. Return: {"term": "", "citation_uses": [{"location": "", "form": ""}], "text_uses": [{"location": "", "form": ""}], "is_consistent": <boolean>}

errors.rule_title: Abbreviations, Numerals, and Symbols - Numerals and Symbols
errors.description: Number 0-99 written as numeral in text instead of spelled out
errors.fix_pattern: Spell out numbers 0-99 in textual sentences

examples.incorrect: The court considered 45 factors in its decision.
examples.correct: The court considered forty-five factors in its decision.

errors.rule_title: Abbreviations, Numerals, and Symbols - Numerals and Symbols
errors.description: Sentence begins with a numeral instead of spelled-out number
errors.fix_pattern: Spell out numbers that begin sentences or restructure sentence

examples.incorrect: 150 people attended the hearing.
examples.correct: One hundred fifty people attended the hearing.

errors.rule_title: Abbreviations, Numerals, and Symbols - Numerals and Symbols
errors.description: Number spelled out in citation when numeral should be used
errors.fix_pattern: Use numerals for all numbers in citations

examples.incorrect: See id. at twenty-three.

errors.rule_title: Abbreviations, Numerals, and Symbols - Numerals and Symbols
errors.description: Number 100 or above spelled out in text when numeral should be used
errors.fix_pattern: Use numerals for numbers 100 and above in text

examples.incorrect: The statute contains one hundred twenty-three provisions.

errors.rule_title: Abbreviations, Numerals, and Symbols - Numerals and Symbols
errors.description: Section symbol (§) used in textual sentence instead of word 'section'
errors.fix_pattern: Use word 'section' in text; use § only in citations

examples.incorrect: The § requires disclosure of material facts.
examples.correct: The section requires disclosure of material facts.

errors.rule_title: Abbreviations, Numerals, and Symbols - Numerals and Symbols
errors.description: Paragraph symbol (¶) used in textual sentence instead of word 'paragraph'
errors.fix_pattern: Use word 'paragraph' in text; use ¶ only in citations

examples.incorrect: The ¶ states the requirements clearly.
examples.correct: The paragraph states the requirements clearly.

errors.rule_title: Abbreviations, Numerals, and Symbols - Numerals and Symbols
errors.description: Word 'section' used in citation instead of § symbol
errors.fix_pattern: Use § symbol in citations

examples.incorrect: See 42 U.S.C. section 1983 (2000).

errors.rule_title: Abbreviations, Numerals, and Symbols - Numerals and Symbols
errors.description: Word 'paragraph' used in citation instead of ¶ symbol
errors.fix_pattern: Use ¶ symbol in citations

examples.incorrect: Id. at paragraph 45.

errors.rule_title: Abbreviations, Numerals, and Symbols - Numerals and Symbols
errors.description: Multiple sections not indicated with §§ (double section symbol)
errors.fix_pattern: Use §§ for multiple sections with range or list format

examples.incorrect: See §§ 101 and 102.

errors.rule_title: Abbreviations, Numerals, and Symbols - Numerals and Symbols
errors.description: Determine if number should be numeral or spelled out
errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Analyze this text segment containing a number. Determine: (1) Is this in a citation or textual sentence? (2) Is the number 0-99 or 100+? (3) Does it start a sentence? (4) Is it an exception case (date, address, statistical data)? Return: {"number": <value>, "is_citation": <boolean>, "starts_sentence": <boolean>, "is_exception": <boolean>, "should_be_spelled": <boolean>, "correct_form": ""}

errors.rule_title: Abbreviations, Numerals, and Symbols - Numerals and Symbols
errors.description: Verify § and ¶ symbols used only in citations
errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Analyze the context around this section or paragraph symbol (§ or ¶). Is it in a citation or in textual prose? In citations, symbols should be used. In text, words ('section', 'paragraph') should be used. Return: {"symbol": "", "is_citation": <boolean>, "is_appropriate": <boolean>, "should_be": ""}

errors.rule_title: Abbreviations, Numerals, and Symbols - Numerals and Symbols
errors.description: Verify proper formatting for multiple section references
errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Check if this citation references multiple sections or paragraphs. Multiple sections should use §§ (double symbol) and appropriate formatting (e.g., §§ 101-103 or §§ 101, 103, 105). Return: {"references_multiple": <boolean>, "uses_double_symbol": <boolean>, "format_correct": <boolean>, "should_be": ""}

errors.regex_detect:
# Any signal at start of citation
^(See|Accord|E\.g\.,?|Cf\.|But see|But cf\.|See also|See generally|Compare)[\s]

# Cf. without parenthetical
\bCf\.\s+[^(]+\([12]\d{3}\)\.(?!\s*\()

# Multiple signals wrong order
(See also|Cf\.)([^;]+);[\s]*(See)(?!\s+also|generally)

# Id without period
\bId\s+at\s+\d+

# Id without "at" before pincite
\bId\.\s+\d+(?!\s*n\.)

# Lowercase id (wrong)
\bid\.\s+at

# Missing period at end of citation sentence
\([12]\d{3}\)[^.]*$

# Case cite missing comma after case name
[A-Z][a-z]+\s+v\.\s+[A-Z][a-z]+\s+\d{1,4}\s+U\.S\.(?!,)

# Wrong double symbol for single section
§§\s+\d+(?![,\-\d])

# Section spelled out in citation (should use §)
\b[Ss]ection\s+\d+[a-z]?\b(?=.*\([12]\d{3}\))

# Supra for case (wrong)
[A-Z][a-z]+\s+v\.\s+[A-Z][a-z]+,\s+supra\s+note

# Supra without note reference
\bsupra\s+at\s+\d+(?!\s+note)

# Hereinafter outside parentheses
hereinafter\s+[^(]
\([A-Z][a-z]+(?:,\s+[A-Z]\.)?(?:,\s+J\.)?,\s+(?:dissenting|concurring|concurring in part and dissenting in part)\)

examples.incorrect: John Smith v. Robert Jones
examples.correct: New York Times Co. v. Sullivan

examples.incorrect: The New York Times Co. v. Sullivan
examples.correct: NLRB v. Jones & Laughlin Steel Corp.

examples.incorrect: Ass'n of Data Processing v. Camp
Smith v. Acme Corp. d/b/a Best Services
Brown v. Board of Education, 347 U.S. 483 (U.S. 1954).
examples.correct: Brown v. Board of Education, 347 U.S. 483 (1954).

examples.incorrect: Ass'n of Data Processing v. Camp
examples.correct: Association of Data Processing v. Camp

examples.incorrect: The New York Times Co. v. Sullivan
examples.correct: New York Times Co. v. Sullivan

examples.incorrect: Smith, Jones, and Brown v. White and Green
Acme Company v. Smith
*Brown v. Board of Education,* 347 U.S. 483
F.Supp.2d
Miranda, supra note 10, at 450.

errors.regex_detect:
# Generic state code
^[A-Z][a-z]{1,4}\.\s+[A-Za-z.]+\s+§§?\s+\d+(-\d+)?(\.\d+)?(\s+\([^)]+\s+\d{4}\))?$

# California codes
^Cal\.\s+(Civ\.|Penal|Bus\.\s+&\s+Prof\.|Health\s+&\s+Safety)\s+Code\s+§§?\s+\d+(\.\d+)?(\s+\(West\s+\d{4}\))?$

# New York codes
^N\.Y\.\s+[A-Za-z.]+\s+Law\s+§§?\s+\d+(\.\d+)?(\s+\(McKinney\s+\d{4}\))?$

# Texas codes
^Tex\.\s+[A-Za-z.]+\s+Code\s+Ann\.\s+§§?\s+\d+(\.\d+)?(\s+\(West\s+\d{4}\))?$

# Federal session law (Pub. L.)
^Pub\.\s+L\.\s+No\.\s+\d{2,3}-\d+,\s+\d+\s+Stat\.\s+\d+(\s+\(\d{4}\))?$

# Federal session law with popular name
^[A-Z][A-Za-z\s]+Act(\s+of\s+\d{4})?,\s+Pub\.\s+L\.\s+No\.\s+\d{2,3}-\d+,\s+\d+\s+Stat\.\s+\d+\s+\(\d{4}\)$

# State session law
^\d{4}\s+[A-Z][a-z]{1,4}\.\s+(Laws|Acts|Sess\.\s+Laws)\s+(ch\.\s+)?\d+$

# U.S. Constitution article
^U\.S\.\s+Const\.\s+art\.\s+[IVX]+,\s+§\s+\d+$

# U.S. Constitution amendment
^U\.S\.\s+Const\.\s+amend\.\s+[IVX]+$

# U.S. Constitution amendment with section
^U\.S\.\s+Const\.\s+amend\.\s+[IVX]+,\s+§\s+\d+$

# State constitution
^[A-Z][a-z]{1,4}\.\s+Const\.\s+art\.\s+[IVX\d]+,\s+§\s+\d+$

# Single section
^§\s+\d+(\([a-z]\))?(\(\d+\))?$

# Multiple sections (range)
^§§\s+\d+-\d+$

# Multiple sections (non-consecutive)
^§§\s+\d+(,\s+\d+)+$

# Section with subsections
^§\s+\d+(\([a-z]\))(\(\d+\))?(\([A-Z]\))?$

# I.R.C.
^I\.R\.C\.\s+§\s+\d+(\([a-z]\))?(\(\d+\))?$

# Federal Rules
^Fed\.\s+R\.\s+(Civ\.|Crim\.|Evid\.|App\.)\s+P\.\s+\d+$

# Model Penal Code
^Model\s+Penal\s+Code\s+§\s+\d+\.\d+\s+\(Am\.\s+Law\s+Inst\.\s+\d{4}\)$

# Restatement
^Restatement\s+\((Second|Third)\)\s+of\s+[A-Za-z]+\s+§\s+\d+\s+\(Am\.\s+Law\s+Inst\.\s+\d{4}\)$

John Doe, Essay on Constitutional Law, in Book of Essays 123 (Jane Smith ed., 2020)
         ^^^ NOT italicized ^^^         ^^ italicized ^^

✓ John Doe, The Future of Constitutional Law, 100 Yale L.J. 1 (2020)
           ^^^ italicized ^^^

✓ Jane Smith, What Is Privacy?, 50 Harv. L. Rev. 234 (2019)
             ^^ italicized (including ?) ^^

✓ John Doe, "The Future of Constitutional Law," 100 Yale L.J. 1 (2020)
           ^^^ in quotation marks ^^^

✓ Article Title, N.Y. Times, Jan. 1, 2020, at A1
  ^^^^^ italicized  ^^^^^^^^ italicized

✓ Jane Doe, Magazine Article, Time, Mar. 2021, at 15
           ^^^^^^^ italicized  ^^^^ italicized

123 HARV. L. REV. 456 (2020)
    ^^^^ small caps ^^^^

50 STAN. L. REV. 1234 (2019)
   ^^^^^ small caps ^^^^^

100 YALE L.J. 1 (2018)
    ^^^^ small caps ^^^^

45 COLUM. L. REV. 678 (2021)
   ^^^^^ small caps ^^^^^

88 GEO. L.J. 234 (2020)
   ^^^^ small caps ^^^^

77 U. CHI. L. REV. 890 (2019)
   ^^^^^^ small caps ^^^^^^

Format: Author, Title page (Year)

John Doe, Book Title 45 (2020)
                     ^^ pinpoint

John Doe, Book Title 45-47 (2020)
                     ^^^^^ pages 45 through 47

John Doe, Book Title 45, 67, 89 (2020)
                     ^^^^^^^^^^ separate pages

Author, Title, Volume Journal First Page, Pinpoint (Year)

John Doe, Article, 123 Harv. L. Rev. 456, 460 (2020)
                                     ^^^  ^^^ pinpoint
                                   first  specific

John Doe, Article, 123 Harv. L. Rev. 456, 460-62 (2020)
                                          ^^^^^^ range

John Doe, Article, 123 Harv. L. Rev. 456, 460, 465 (2020)
                                          ^^^^^^^^^^ separate

Full: John Doe, Article, 123 Harv. L. Rev. 456 (2020)
Id.: Id. at 460
        ^^ pinpoint

Id. at 460-61
    ^^ different pinpoint

Full in note 5: John Doe, Article, 123 Harv. L. Rev. 456 (2020)
Short in note 15: Doe, supra note 5, at 460
                                     ^^ pinpoint

John Doe, Article, 123 Harv. L. Rev. 456, 460 n.4 (2020)
                                          ^^^^^^ page 460, footnote 4

John Doe, Book Title 45 n.12 (2020)
                     ^^^^^^ page 45, footnote 12

Author, Title § 15.3 (Year)
             ^^^^^^ section 15.3

Author, Article, 123 J. 456, 460 ¶ 15 (Year)
                             ^^^^^ paragraph 15

errors.error_name: Using unofficial reporter when U.S. is available
errors.description: Using unofficial reporter when U.S. is available

errors.error_name: Incorrect spacing in 'S. Ct.' or 'L. Ed.'
errors.description: Incorrect spacing in 'S. Ct.' or 'L. Ed.'

errors.error_name: Forgetting to include year in parentheses
errors.description: Forgetting to include year in parentheses

errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Validate that this Supreme Court citation uses 'U.S.' as the preferred reporter when available. Check: (1) Reporter abbreviation has proper periods and spacing, (2) Volume and page numbers are present, (3) Year is in parentheses at the end.
If this citation uses an unofficial reporter (S. Ct., L. Ed., U.S.L.W.) and the case is in U.S. Reports, suggest changing to U.S. citation. Ensure proper Bluebook format with spaces and periods.
Brown v. Board of Education, 347 U.S. 483 (1954)

errors.error_name: Using 'F. Appx' instead of 'F. App'x' (apostrophe required)
errors.description: Using 'F. Appx' instead of 'F. App'x' (apostrophe required)

errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Verify this circuit court citation: (1) Reporter is F., F.2d, F.3d, or F. App'x, (2) Circuit is properly designated (e.g., '2d Cir.' not '2nd Cir.'), (3) Year follows circuit designation in parentheses.
Check if 'F.2nd' or 'F.3rd' appears and change to 'F.2d' or 'F.3d'. Verify circuit abbreviation uses ordinal format (1st, 2d, 3d, 4th, etc.). Ensure apostrophe in 'F. App'x'.
United States v. Smith, 123 F.3d 456 (5th Cir. 1997)

errors.error_name: Omitting space in 'F. Supp.' or using 'F.Supp.'
errors.description: Omitting space in 'F. Supp.' or using 'F.Supp.'

errors.error_name: Using 'F. Supp. 2nd' or 'F. Supp. 3rd' instead of '2d' or '3d'
errors.description: Using 'F. Supp. 2nd' or 'F. Supp. 3rd' instead of '2d' or '3d'

errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Check district court citation: (1) Reporter is F. Supp., F. Supp. 2d, F. Supp. 3d, F.R.D., or B.R., (2) Proper spacing after 'F.' and 'Supp.', (3) District designation is correct (e.g., 'S.D.N.Y.' for Southern District of New York), (4) Year included.
Fix spacing in 'F. Supp.' (space after each period). Change '2nd/3rd' to '2d/3d'. Verify district abbreviation follows Bluebook Table T1.
Smith v. Jones, 789 F. Supp. 2d 123 (S.D.N.Y. 2011)
Ensure Federal Circuit citations specify '(Fed. Cir. YEAR)' in the parenthetical, not just a numbered circuit.
Add 'Fed. Cir.' designation if missing from parenthetical.
Apple Inc. v. Samsung Elecs. Co., 678 F.3d 1314 (Fed. Cir. 2012)

errors.error_name: Using old reporter abbreviations for recent cases
errors.description: Using old reporter abbreviations for recent cases

errors.gpt_validation_prompt: For Court of Federal Claims cases after 1992, ensure 'Fed. Cl.' is used (not 'Cl. Ct.' or 'Ct. Cl.').
Update reporter abbreviation to 'Fed. Cl.' for post-1992 cases.
Contractor v. United States, 45 Fed. Cl. 678 (2000)

errors.error_name: Using alternative reporters when official is available
errors.description: Using alternative reporters when official is available

errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Check that Court of International Trade citations use 'Ct. Int'l Trade' with apostrophe in 'Int'l'.
Ensure apostrophe is present in "Int'l" and prefer official reporter when available.
Import Co. v. United States, 123 Ct. Int'l Trade 456 (1999)

errors.error_name: Incorrect format for Pub. L. No.
errors.description: Incorrect format for Pub. L. No.

errors.error_name: Missing spaces or periods in 'Pub. L. No.'
errors.description: Missing spaces or periods in 'Pub. L. No.'

errors.error_name: Using Pacific Reporter without Alaska designation
errors.description: Using Pacific Reporter without Alaska designation

errors.error_name: Not distinguishing Court of Appeals from Supreme Court
errors.description: Not distinguishing Court of Appeals from Supreme Court

errors.error_name: Missing 'Rev. Stat. Ann.' in statutory citations
errors.description: Missing 'Rev. Stat. Ann.' in statutory citations

errors.error_name: Confusing Cal. Stat. (session laws) with statutory codes
errors.description: Confusing Cal. Stat. (session laws) with statutory codes

errors.error_name: Confusing D.C. Court of Appeals with U.S. Court of Appeals for D.C. Circuit
errors.description: Confusing D.C. Court of Appeals with U.S. Court of Appeals for D.C. Circuit

errors.error_name: Confusing Court of Appeals (highest court) with Court of Special Appeals (intermediate)
errors.description: Confusing Court of Appeals (highest court) with Court of Special Appeals (intermediate)

errors.error_name: Confusing Court of Appeals (highest) with Appellate Division
errors.description: Confusing Court of Appeals (highest) with Appellate Division

errors.error_name: Not specifying department for Appellate Division
errors.description: Not specifying department for Appellate Division

errors.error_name: Confusing Superior Court with Commonwealth Court
errors.description: Confusing Superior Court with Commonwealth Court

errors.error_name: Not specifying which intermediate appellate court
errors.description: Not specifying which intermediate appellate court

errors.error_name: Not specifying which Court of Appeals district
errors.description: Not specifying which Court of Appeals district

errors.error_name: Confusing Supreme Court (civil) with Court of Criminal Appeals
errors.description: Confusing Supreme Court (civil) with Court of Criminal Appeals

errors.error_name: Using U.S. citation format for foreign cases
errors.description: Using U.S. citation format for foreign cases

errors.error_name: Missing required elements for specific jurisdictions
errors.description: Missing required elements for specific jurisdictions

errors.gpt_validation_prompt: For foreign jurisdiction citations, consult Bluebook Table T2 online for country-specific requirements. Common foreign jurisdictions include: United Kingdom (U.K.), European Union (E.U.), Canada, Australia, etc. Each has unique citation formats.
Foreign citations require jurisdiction-specific formatting per Table T2. Identify the country and apply appropriate rules from Bluebook online Table T2.
Foreign case citations typically include: Case name, citation to reporter/court, jurisdiction designation, and year. Format varies significantly by country.

errors.error_name: Missing periods in abbreviations (e.g., 'UN' instead of 'U.N.')
errors.description: Missing periods in abbreviations (e.g., 'UN' instead of 'U.N.')

errors.error_name: Confusing different court reporters (I.C.J. vs. P.C.I.J.)
errors.description: Confusing different court reporters (I.C.J. vs. P.C.I.J.)

errors.gpt_validation_prompt: For international organization citations, verify: (1) Correct abbreviation with periods, (2) Proper document symbol or case number, (3) Appropriate reporter or series, (4) Complete date information, (5) Compliance with specific T3 subsection rules.
Check abbreviations match Table T3 exactly. Ensure document symbols follow organization's format. Include all required elements (case number, series, page, date).
International citations vary by organization. U.N. uses 'U.N. Doc.' with symbols. I.C.J. uses 'Year I.C.J. Page'. E.U. uses 'O.J.' for legislation. Always include periods in abbreviations.

errors.error_name: Not including treaty name and parties
errors.description: Not including treaty name and parties

errors.error_name: Missing series designation (L for legislation, C for information)
errors.description: Missing series designation (L for legislation, C for information)

errors.error_name: Using unofficial source when official is available
errors.description: Using unofficial source when official is available

errors.error_name: Italicizing treaty names (should not be italicized)
errors.description: Italicizing treaty names (should not be italicized)

errors.error_name: Not identifying parties for bilateral treaties
errors.description: Not identifying parties for bilateral treaties

errors.error_name: Using wrong source for time period (e.g., U.S.T. for pre-1950 or post-1984)
errors.description: Using wrong source for time period (e.g., U.S.T. for pre-1950 or post-1984)

errors.gpt_validation_prompt: Verify treaty citation: (1) Treaty name not italicized, (2) Parties identified if bilateral, (3) Full date (Month Day, Year), (4) Appropriate source for time period, (5) Proper abbreviation format with periods, (6) Volume and page/number included.
Check treaty source matches signing date: Pre-1950 use Stat., 1950-1984 use U.S.T., 1945+ use T.I.A.S. For multilateral, cite to U.N.T.S. when available. Ensure abbreviations have periods.
Treaties cite to official sources first. Format: Treaty Name, Parties, Month Day, Year, Source. Don't italicize treaty names. Include volume and page or series number.

errors.error_name: Using old 'S. Exec. Doc.' format for recent treaties
errors.description: Using old 'S. Exec. Doc.' format for recent treaties

errors.error_name: Using I.L.M. when official source is available
errors.description: Using I.L.M. when official source is available

errors.error_name: Not distinguishing between ICSID Rep. (reporter) and ICSID Rev. (journal)
errors.description: Not distinguishing between ICSID Rep. (reporter) and ICSID Rev. (journal)

errors.error_name: Missing case numbers for institutional arbitrations
errors.description: Missing case numbers for institutional arbitrations

errors.error_name: Not specifying type of decision (Award vs. Interim Award vs. Jurisdictional Decision)
errors.description: Not specifying type of decision (Award vs. Interim Award vs. Jurisdictional Decision)

errors.error_name: Using unofficial sources when official reporter available
errors.description: Using unofficial sources when official reporter available

errors.error_name: Missing periods in abbreviations (R.I.A.A., ICSID Rep.)
errors.description: Missing periods in abbreviations (R.I.A.A., ICSID Rep.)

errors.gpt_validation_prompt: For arbitral awards, verify: (1) Case name with parties, (2) Case number if institutional arbitration, (3) Type of decision specified, (4) Appropriate reporter abbreviation with periods, (5) Tribunal identified, (6) Complete date (Month Day, Year).

Check reporter abbreviation: ICSID Rep. (not ICSID Rev. unless unavailable), R.I.A.A. with periods, proper spacing in 'Hague Ct. Rep.' Include case number for ICSID, ICC, PCA cases. Specify award type.

Arbitral awards cite to official reporter when available (ICSID Rep., R.I.A.A., ITLOS Rep.). Include case number, award type, tribunal, and date. For unpublished awards, cite to repository or party materials with descriptive information.

errors.error_name: CRITICAL: Cf. signal missing required parenthetical
errors.description: Redbook 1.12 REQUIRES explanatory parentheticals for Cf. and But cf.

examples.incorrect: Cf. Smith v. Jones, 123 U.S. 456 (2000).
examples.correct: Cf. Smith v. Jones, 123 U.S. 456 (2000) (applying similar standard).

errors.error_name: CRITICAL: See generally incorrectly has parenthetical
errors.description: Redbook 1.12 FORBIDS explanatory parentheticals with See generally

examples.incorrect: See generally Smith, 100 U.S. 1 (2000) (background).

errors.error_name: CRITICAL: But cf. missing required parenthetical
errors.description: Redbook 1.12 REQUIRES explanatory parentheticals for But cf.

examples.incorrect: But cf. Smith, 100 U.S. 1 (2000).
examples.correct: But cf. Smith, 100 U.S. 1 (2000) (reaching opposite conclusion).
